page.syntax: Text as C = GetLineText as C([lineNumer as n])

argument.name: Text
argument.description: The text contents of a line.

argument.name: lineNumer
argument.description: Optional. Default = current line. The number of a line in the StringScanner buffer.

page.description: Return the text of the line we are on, if optional requested line is set, we go to the begginning of the specified line first.
page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.GetLineText() function retrieves the text of the current line or of any specified line in the StringScanner buffer. Lines are defined by CR-LF.
page.example: dim scanner as StringScanner dim txt as C txt = <<%text% This is line one and this is line two and finally line three %text% scanner = stringscanner.Create(txt) ? scanner.ScanOver(24) = This is line one and th ? scanner.GetLineText() = "and this is line two" ? scanner.GetLineText(3) = "and finally line three"
